Name.BusinessNameLine1: US Committee for Refugees and Immigrants Inc

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To address the needs and rights of persons in forced or voluntary migration world by advancing fair and humane public policy, facilitating and providing direct professional services, and promoting the full participation of migrants in community life.
IRS990.MissionDescription: To address the needs and rights of persons in forced or voluntary migration world by advancing fair and humane public policy, facilitating and providing direct professional services, and promoting the full participation of migrants in community life.

IRS990ScheduleA.GeneralExplanation: Schedule A, Part II, Line 10, Explanation of Other Income: MISCELLANEOUS

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: USCRI adopted ASC 740-10 (FASB Interpretation No. 48, "Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes"(FIN 48)) on October 1, 2009. Under ASC 740-10, USCRI must recognize the tax benefit associated with tax positions taken for tax return purposes when it is more-likely than not that the position will not be sustained on examination. The implementation of ASC 740-10 had no impact on USCRI's financial statements. USCRI does not believe there are any unrecognized tax benefits that should be recorded. No interest or penalties were accrued as of October 1, 2009 as a result of the adoption of ASC 740-10. For the year ended September 30, 2010, there were no interest or penalties recorded or included in the statements of activities. USCRI is still open to examination by taxing authorities from 2007 forward.

RecipientNameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: College of Southern Idaho Refugee Service Center

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Every quarter, the receiving agency submits expense reports to USCRI. USCRI staff visit the agencies and make sure they are in compliance with the program requirements.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 1
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Between meetings of the Board the Executive Committee shall have and may exercise all of the powers of the Board. However, the Executive Committee shall not have authority to: fill vacancies in the Board or any committee; amend or repeal the Bylaws or adopt new Bylaws or amend or repeal any resolution of the Board that by its terms shall not be so amendable or repealable; or take any action required by law or these Bylaws to be submitted to the Board for approval. Any action taken by the Executive Committee between meetings of the Board shall be reported to the Board at its next meeting. All members of the Executive Committee are members of the Board.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Lawrence Rosenthal and Kenneth Blackman - Family Relationship

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The members of the organization shall be the persons serving as the Directors of the Corporation.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Members shall elect the Directors of the Corporation, other than any ex officio Director and Directors elected to fill vacancies as provided in Article II, Section 2 of the Bylaws, and shall vote on such business as may come before the membership.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Organization's accounting firm prepares the IRS form 990 using the audited A-133 financial statements. All information not in the financial statements is provided by USCRI's Comptroller. The accounting firm sends the prepared form 990 to the CFO & Comptroller for review. The final copy is signed by the Vice President & CFO. The finished copy of the 990 is provided to the Board members.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Board reviews the financials three times of the year, management informs them about all the activities.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Management proposed employee's salary increase to board and Board makes decision for yearly salary increase, CEO and CFO's compensation.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization makes its governing documents and conflict of interest policy available upon request, and financial statements are made available on the organization's website as well as through the Better Business Bureau and Guidestar.
There have been no changes during the year in the process for oversight of the audit of the financial statements.
